qas.question: In which year was the Warsaw Pact established?
Which nation formed the nucleus of the Warsaw Pact?
Which conflict was the impetus for the formation of the Pact?
How many Soviet allied countries were members of the Warsaw Pact?
The acceptance of which country into NATO prompted the formation of the Warsaw Pact?
What was formally known as the Pact of Friendship?
Which treaty included the Soviet Union and eight Soviet satellite states?
The Paris Pacts of 1955 integrated whom into NATO?
East Germany was integrated in NATO in what year?

context: The <b5_0><b6_0>Warsaw Pact<b6_0/><b5_0/> (formally, the Treaty of Friendship, Co-operation, and Mutual Assistance, sometimes, informally WarPac, akin in format to NATO) was a collective defense treaty among <a1_0>Soviet Union<a1_0/> and <a3_0>seven<a3_0/> Soviet satellite states in Central and Eastern Europe in existence during <a2_0>the Cold War<a2_0/>. The Warsaw Pact was the military complement to the Council for Mutual Economic Assistance (CoMEcon), the regional economic organization for the communist states of Central and Eastern Europe. The Warsaw Pact was created in reaction to the integration of <a4_0><b7_0>West Germany<b7_0/><a4_0/> into NATO in <a0_0><b8_0>1955<b8_0/><a0_0/> per the Paris Pacts of 1954, but it is also considered to have been motivated by Soviet desires to maintain control over military forces in Central and Eastern Europe.
